definition: to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: He always borrows money from others but the repayment is on the Greek calends .
sentences.chinese: 當心那傢伙，他總是找別人借錢，但是從不還錢。

sentences.english: He CNNs his old friends for not lending money to him.
sentences.chinese: 老朋友們因爲不願意借錢給他而遭到他無恥地辱罵。

sentences.english: She used to borrow money from her friends.
sentences.chinese: 她常向她的朋友們借錢。

sentences.english: First you borrow, then you beg.
sentences.chinese: 頭一遭借錢，下一遭就討飯。

sentences.english: It's impossible to borrow some money from him. He is a real skinflint .
sentences.chinese: 向他借錢是不可能的，他確實是個吝嗇鬼。

sentences.english: I am not well-off either. You'd better borrow money from Laoli, who is comfortably off .
sentences.chinese: 我也不富裕，你還是去家境寬展的老李那兒借錢吧。

sentences.english: She has her doubts about loaning him more money.
sentences.chinese: 她對是否再借錢給他不無疑慮。

sentences.english: That shiftiness was also recognised by those whose money was actually at stake.
sentences.chinese: 那些借錢出來的人同樣識別面相變化。

sentences.english: SunHao foursquare to lend money to hin son, make hin for his son manner transformation.
sentences.chinese: 孫浩直爽地借錢給欣兒，令欣兒對他態度轉變。

sentences.english: You might as well throw your money into the sea as lend it to that rascal.
sentences.chinese: 你借錢給那個無賴，不啻把錢丟在海里。

sentences.english: Loan to any financial company. Mag loan sa banko.
sentences.chinese: 不可向任何財務公司借錢。

sentences.english: These shenanigans naturally made creditors unwilling to lend to governments.
sentences.chinese: 這些詭計自然讓債權人不願借錢給政府。

sentences.english: Borrow money from China, and give out those food stamps Obama.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬從中國借錢，給美國人發糧票。
借錢纔到手，立刻便擔憂。
借錢纔到手，馬上便憂愁。

sentences.english: If you would make an enemy,lend a man money and ask it of him again.
sentences.chinese: 你若想與人結怨，只須先借錢給他，再向他催討。

definition: to take the initiative/to do sth of one's own accord/spontaneous/active/opposite: passive 被動|被动[bei4 dong4]/drive (of gears and shafts etc)
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
a relative (i.e. family relation)/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
just in case/if by any chance/contingency
